outline: Defining the 'Coach' vs. 'Clinician' boundary in high-stakes health scenarios.

Ethical handling of lab data: How to discuss functional testing results without 'diagnosing'.
Referral networks: Establishing professional protocols for medical collaboration and emergency escalations.
The ethics of influence: Managing conflicts of interest in supplement recommendations and brand partnerships.

lessons.title: Evidence-Based Practice: Navigating Microbiome Research
outline: The hierarchy of evidence: Distinguishing between murine studies, observational data, and gold-standard RCTs.
Interpreting statistical significance: Understanding p-values, confidence intervals, and effect sizes in gut health literature.
Identifying 'Science-Washing': How to spot marketing-driven claims in the probiotic and functional food industry.
Continuous learning systems: Setting up a workflow for staying current with the latest microbiome discoveries.
Translating research to practice: Safely incorporating emerging evidence into client protocols.

lessons.title: The AccrediPro Coaching Framework: Final Competency
outline: Mastering the 'Support, Educate, Empower' (SEE) methodology at an expert level.
Behavioral change psychology: Advanced motivational interviewing for resistant clients.
The Client Journey Map: Ensuring a premium experience from the initial discovery call to graduation.
Communication excellence: Explaining complex microbial concepts through accessible analogies and visual aids.
Self-Assessment: Evaluating your coaching presence, empathy, and professional authority.

lessons.title: Final Examination & Practical Assessment Prep
outline: Structure of the L4 Certification Exam: Understanding the weighting of science, coaching, and business modules.
